intro: Hibbertia puberula subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The subspecies glabrescens is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to the typical form. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. This plant is often found in shrublands and is adapted to dry conditions.
